docs.lead_paragraph: Cocaine, known to have caused mental aberrations through nonmedical use, can also cause hallucinations and paranoia when used in hospitals in its liquid painkiller form, doctors warn. Four physicians, in a report in the issue of The New England Journal of Medicine dated Thursday, described a case of ''cocaine psychosis.'' They said they hoped other doctors would become aware of the potential hazard of the drug, which is widely used as a surface anesthetic.

headline.main: COCAINE TREATMENT IS SAID TO CAUSE PARANOIA
